title: Hide Cloud and Watson specific options in Page Builder
body:
## Problem/Description
The core team would like to limit the amount of options exposed on the Page Builder content type form.

## Proposed Solution
Unless `/cloud` or `/watson` is selected as the 
    Page Properties > Web Segment > Level 1 
The following fields should be hidden


### Lead Spaces

LEAD SPACE > Create lead space

![image.png](https://zenhub.ibm.com/images/5b04301b659952e55a846c47/24facb5a-2b45-4ee7-9613-1f19b08ca18b)

- Module 1E
- Module 2E
- Module 2F (Old) 
- Module 3E
- Module 4E
- Module 5E
- Module 5E (Light)
- Module 6E
- Cloud Leadspace


### Bands

BANDS > Create new content > Choose layout

![image.png](https://zenhub.ibm.com/images/5b04301b659952e55a846c47/50dee4b1-8ba3-427a-9d7c-74da5545d4cc)

- Cloud Blog Listing
- Cloud Blog Subscription
- Cloud Learn topic listing
- Cloud Promo Group
- Cloud Spacer
- Promo Group
- Promo Group: Watson
- Watson Health Spacer
- Watson Spacer

## Additional Information
- we have a method for hiding fields already that was created as part of #347 and #436
- I would imagine this would be the methodology that we would use to accomplish this
- initial spike: #1011

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] Lead space options described above only appear when the cloud or watson segment are chosen in the page properties > web segment > level 1
- [ ] Band options described above only appear when the cloud or watson segment are chosen in the page properties > web segment > level 1

### Testing Instructions
<!-- Add any specific instructions for testing the acceptance criteria. -->
1. Open a new page builder form
2. Ensure that the lead space options outlined above only appear when cloud or watson segments are chosen in the page properties section
3. Ensure that the band options outlined above only appear when cloud or watson segments are chosen in the page properties section

title: Cloud and Watson theme footer should point to updated version of mega_menu_nav.js
body:
## Describe the Bug
'Learn' > 'Customer' link in the Cloud footer is still linking to 'https://www.ibm.com/cloud-computing/bluemix/data-centers' instead of 'https://www.ibm.com/cloud/case-studies' on PROD. 

It turns out the change was made in version 4 of mega menu js file (https://1.cms.s81c.com/themes/custom/ibm_cloud/js/mega_menu_nav.v4.js?v=4) (see https://github.ibm.com/MSC-Cloud/dev/issues/1043) however the PROD is still pointing to version 3 (https://1.cms.s81c.com/themes/custom/ibm_cloud/js/mega_menu_nav.v4.js?v=3). Hence the reason why the production team is not seeing the update. 

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://www.ibm.com/cloud
2. INSPECT the link in the footer for Learn > Customer
3. Notice that the link is incorrect.

## Expected behavior
The link source should be updated so that a redirect is not needed.

### Considerations
- original change to nav.js file here: https://github.ibm.com/MSC-Cloud/dev/issues/1043

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] When inspecting the footer links for Learn > Customer, the href should be `https://www.ibm.com/cloud/case-studies`

title: Allow default content import from UI
body:
When testing #957 on ODE, we have realized the default content will be deleted when a database downsync from production happens, and we have no other way to force a re-import of the default content.

The goal of this ticket is to create a form on the UI which allows the user to re-import the content from a specific sprint when it's not present on the environment.

title: Module 7F: Use Video Placeholder Image field instead of placeholder image pulled from YT
body: ## Describe the Bug The placeholder image and the alt text that an editor enter for Module 7F video display doesn't get rendered. Instead some other image and alt text are being rendered. ## To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create or edit an existing Module 7F band. 2. Create or edit an existing video within this band 3. Upload a placeholder image and populate the alt text field 4. Save the video, band and the page. 5. Notice the uploaded placeholder images doesn't get rendered and some other alt text is being used instead of the one entered via the edit form. ## Expected behavior Uploaded video placeholder image and alt text populated by the editor should get rendered. ## Screenshots Image and alt text that are being rendered in the front. Image and alt text that is uploaded and populated via the edit form. ## Desktop - OS: - Browser: - Version: ## Mobile - Device: - OS: - Browser: - Version: ### Considerations ## Resolution ### Acceptance Criteria (required) - [ ] Pages containing Module 7F with a video have a placeholder image and required alt text. ### Build/Deployment Steps 1. Step 1 ### Testing Instructions 1. Step 1

title: Make widgets revisionable
body:
## Describe the Bug
Widgets should be revisionable.

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a page builder page with a boilerplate widget, then publish it.
1. Create a new draft of the page and edit the configuration for the boilerplate. Check the button has the new content under the `Latest` tab.
1. The `View` tab also has the new content.

## Expected behavior
The `View` tab shows the old content, the `Latest` tab shows the new content.

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] The _latest_ version of the page shows the new widget text being moderated.
- [ ] The _live_ version of the page shows the old (and approved) version of the page.

title: Learn Hub Globalization Phase 1
body:
Development Base Branch: `feature/learn-hub-g11n-phase-1`

## Description
This is the MVP for a globalizable learn hub.  It consists of ensuring that the taxonomy terms, listing page articles list, and basic components of the articles are globalizable.

## Designs/Comps
- https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/526979612882

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] Learn Hub Home Page is fully globalized.
- [ ] Learn Hub listing page contains translated filter list, limited to terms that have translated versions of articles tagged to them. (No empty results).
- [ ] Only articles that have translations into the proper language show in the results. (ex. Only French articles in the French page results).
- [ ] Article pages have a translated Lead space, body, and term listing.
- [ ] All content on Globalized pages is translated.  The Clamp (header and footer) should be covered by default, so all other components within the content area should also be translated as part of this work.

title: Hybrid Cloud/Duo: Module 1E headline text is not sizing to its container.
body:
## Describe the Bug
- Looks like the script that we're using to resize the Lead-space heading is not loading correctly for Module 1E.

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

- Create a page builder node.
- Lead Space - Add Lead Space
  - Content ID: (Naming Guidance for Drupal Content)
  - Choose Layout: Module 1E
  - Headline: Design: 30 characters | Drupal: 100 character, maximum. 1 line break allowed.
  - Subhead: Design: 60 characters | Drupal: 200 characters, maximum
  - Inline Image: Design: 1312x560 @1X, PNG, and under 500KB
  - Band Background Image: Design: 1312x560 @2X, 1:2 ratio, and under 350KB
  - Call to Action - Add CTA (Note: This module/band layout accepts multiple related CTAs) 
    - Admin Title: (Naming Guidance for Drupal Content)
    - URL: (add your URL value here)
    - Link Properties
      - Link Text: (add your Link Text value here: eg. "Explore Offerings")

## Expected behavior
![box-image 1](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/194681/files/4b48ff00-deb6-11e9-913c-72f324206f53)


## Screenshot of the bug
![image 16](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/194681/files/5ac84800-deb6-11e9-98a2-f2fb9686d68c)


## Desktop
 - OS: All
 - Browser: All
 - Version: All

## Mobile
 - Device: All
 - OS: All
 - Browser: All
 - Version: All


## Resolution
- Make sure the `fitty()` function loads correctly.

### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] The headline text should fill the max-container of the leadspace area.

### Build/Deployment Steps
<!-- List any steps that need to be performed manually to complete the work for this ticket. -->
1. Step 1

### Testing Instructions
<!-- Add any specific instructions for testing the acceptance criteria. -->
1. Step 1

title: Widget editorial props should be translatable
body:
## Describe the Bug
As part of testing #1034 we discovered that widget instances cannot be properly translated.

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a page builder page (for instance `/cloud/widget-localization-test`) that contains a Boilerplate widget in `en-us`. Configure the widget with the text `"Test (en-us)"`. Publish the page step by step.
2. Translate the page builder page into `es-es`. Configure the widget with the text `"Prueba (es-es)"`. Publish the page step by step.
3. Navigate to `/cloud/widget-localization-test` the button should show the text `"Test (en-us)"`.
4. Use the language dropdown in the footer to select the Spanish version of the page. Alternatively you can go to `/es-es/cloud/widget-localization-test`.

## Expected behavior
The widget is present in the Spanish translation and ti should show the text `"Prueba (es-es)"`.

### Considerations

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] The widget is shown in the Spanish translation of the page.
- [ ] The button text is `"Prueba (es-es)"`.

title: Component Library/Catalogue for Hybrid Cloud Modules/Bands
body:
## Requestors/Champions
- @Putra-Bonaccorsi @avilaa @Shawn-Hoglund 

## Problem/Motivation
- There's a desire to create a centralize codebase that can be used by other platforms outside of Drupal.
- There's a lack of transparency regarding the status and construction of each module/band that are in the Hybrid Cloud/Duo Drupal theme.
- We need to streamline some of these component templates so that they're easy to adjust.

## Considerations
- Pattern Lab vs Fractal
- Gather a list of goals for this initiative. 
  - It would be good for us to touch base with the other teams (Design, Production, and etc) to get a sense of what they'd like to get out of this initiative because they're most likely going to be the end users/audiences of this library.
  - For instance, a team that's looking to launch a marketing page outside of Drupal might want to use components/bands that were designed by the Hybrid Cloud team. They should be able to easily view the HTML, CSS, JS, Icons, Design Guidelines and etc that are used to assemble each component (see attached).

![Screen Shot 2019-09-19 at 3.51.31 PM.png](https://zenhub.ibm.com/images/5bdb68258eb9954be0b78fa3/bdca7f9f-ac72-4213-b749-5dd7c4723724)


## Constraints
- If the Carbon/DDL codebase is stable and ready for the public, should we formulate a plan to migrate the current v19a classes used in the Hybrid Cloud theme to reflect the new Carbon/DDL?

## Resources (discussions, documents, etc)
- Hybrid Cloud Drupal Modules/Bands: https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/521921572211
- Hybrid Cloud Drupal Modules Content Entry Guide: https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/477303784505?s=hekn8c05jj07stn27f2d4ky4qnrl57z9

*More information coming soon!*

title: Enable streaming video from Kaltura for select lead space bands
body: So now that we have access to use Kaltura for streaming video, it's crucial to implement that feature as an option for our lead space bands. The lead space bands are the key introduction to any of our marketing pages and as such we need to make sure they can support video on a broader level. the current embedded version of videos are limiting both by file size and by the duration and physical size. It's also a bottleneck since its not streaming and instead has to load up front. Implementing the feature will allow us to have a much better user experience with video as well as house all the videos in one place as we begin to accrue brand approved content.  **We will need this feature added to bands 2E, 3E and 5E**

title: Watson Health: Create new "Module 13A"
body:
Add Module 13A that's being used to display content in tabs format

Technical requirements:
Add a new display mode called "Module 13A" to the Promo Group listing
Export Drupal configs
Implement Module 13A into the Hybrid Cloud theme that includes responsive styling.

![box-image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/194681/files/13fdcc80-da36-11e9-9110-cc232171397a)
![box-image 1](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/194681/files/16602680-da36-11e9-9179-83ed96a7e05e)


NOTE: I've looked at what AKQA developed and it looks like they're using a different "Choose Layout" selection that's outside of the way we're currently managing our Hybrid Cloud promo group creation. We can utility the front-end work that they've implemented (CSS and JS), but we'll need to implement the field theming that follows the content modal that we have currently.

title: Ensure that globalized data can be fed out through JSON API
body:
When feeding out data through JSON API, we need a way to ensure that when the content being fed out is globalized, the JSON API has a means of feeding that data out as well.

If this is already built-in, great! If not, let's see what we can do.

Widget developer will also need to understand how to retrieve and work with this data.

title: Architect a means of managing content for a widget
body:
The use case here is the case studies, but we can generalize that a bit. Let's call it 'filtered cards'.

We need a way to input cards as a discrete collection in Drupal so that a widget could hit an endpoint and get all of the cards data in that collection.

Meta data needed on the cards:
- title
- description
- link
- term (to be used as the filter criteria in the widget)

We'll need to know what the endpoint is in Drupal that our React application can hit to retrieve this data then.

title: Install JSON API
body:
Install the JSON API module.

Since the overall goal is to get this installed and a content type feeding out json to a react app, this is the logical place to start. Perhaps a new branch based off of our existing one where widgets are enabled?

Please see linked Epic for more details.

title: Hybrid Cloud/Duo Theme Version: 1.0.0
body:
## Requestors/Champions
- @avilaa @Shawn-Hoglund @Putra-Bonaccorsi 

## Description
- The Hybrid Cloud/Duo theme was created to extrapolate design patterns/components that are in the Watson and Cloud sub-themes in order to streamline these shared design patterns to build out their pages, and rather than duplicate code between base themes, we generalized it into this parent theme. - It includes v19a codebase (https://www.ibm.com/standards/web/whats-new.html) and additional CSS and JS that are needed to construct some of these modules/bands.

## Goals
- Have a stable official release with little maintenance (eg. bugs, design requests, etc).


### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] When all of the high priority requests in this box note (https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/457472390583) has been addressed/competed.

title: Hybrid Cloud/Duo: Add play button to Module 1B when there's a video reference applied.
body:
## Problem/Description
- The current design of Module 1B is missing the "Play" button when a video overlay is added.
- The production team and the designers agree that a "Play" button makes sense for this area.

![image 17](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/194681/files/186a4700-d557-11e9-8418-6422bf036c63)


## Proposed Solution
- When a video reference is enabled with the "Module 1B" promo display mode, add a markup that showcases the play button.
- The play button should be centered aligned with 10% overlay on the image and should have the same look and feel as implemented in this ticket (https://github.ibm.com/MSC-Cloud/dev/issues/989).

## Additional Information
- This request was bought up by Carrie Crabtree in the `#drupal-hc-page-build` Slack channel - https://ibm-marketing-comms.slack.com/archives/CKPRZ99LL/p1568239541003600
- Trello card - https://trello.com/c/hsivpYUd/90-module-1b-band-add-play-button-over-the-images-when-its-a-video


### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] The play button is showing up correctly when there's a video reference value attached to the promo/card node.

### Build/Deployment Steps
<!-- List any steps that need to be performed manually to complete the work for this ticket. -->
1. Step 1

### Testing Instructions
<!-- Add any specific instructions for testing the acceptance criteria. -->
1. Step 1

title: Add a fix to address the import config failing issue when `module_2f` is removed from the `field.storage.node.field_layout_list` config

milestone.title: Xurkitree (2019-37)
milestone.description: Projected Release Date: **Oct 1, 2019**

body:
## Problem/Description
- Config import fails when `module_2f` is removed from the `field.storage.node.field_layout_list` config.

```
[33mIn ConfigImportCommands.php line 259:[39m
[37;41m                                                                               [39;49m
[37;41m  The import failed due to the following reasons:                              [39;49m
[37;41m  Unexpected error during import with operation update for field.storage.node  [39;49m
[37;41m  .field_layout_list: A list field (field_layout_list) with existing data can  [39;49m
[37;41m  not have its keys changed.                                                   [39;49m
[37;41m                                                                               [39;49m
```
Slack message: https://ibm-marketing-comms.slack.com/archives/GCSPRCWBW/p1568253460053300

## Proposed Solution
- Implement an entity query that looks for any leadspace nodes using the `module_2f` display mode value and updates it with the correct layout selection called `module_5e`.

## Additional Information
- From Greg J regarding the proposed solution above.

> On the solution verify the issue is you cannot have data using that allowed value vs any data and  yes I am OK it update hook to update it before importing removal.  Be sure to test across things like only published.  published and a draft in flight which is not always simple.

- A temporary fix has been merged and deployed to UAT so that it will resolve the issue. https://github.ibm.com/content-mgmt-system/ibm_com_drupal/pull/12720

### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] 

### Build/Deployment Steps
<!-- List any steps that need to be performed manually to complete the work for this ticket. -->
1. Step 1

### Testing Instructions
<!-- Add any specific instructions for testing the acceptance criteria. -->
1. Step 1

title: Provide Default Link Target Behavior for CTAs with Optional Override
body:
## User Story
As a **Content Creator**  
I want **CTA links to auto-select the proper target, but leave the options available to override**  
So that **I have manual control over every CTA link's opening behavior**

## Scope
Design Module 3C

## References
Designs/Comps: 
Docs:

## Proposed Solution
1. Add some JS to detect the hostname in the URL field and, if it does not end in `.ibm.com`, select the "New Window" radio option.
2. Move the Link Target field into a collapsed fieldset labeled Target Override.

## Considerations
Will this effect all CTA implementations? 

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] When creating a CTA with an internal URL, the Link Target is automatically set to "Same window"
- [ ] When creating a CTA with an external URL, the Link Target is automatically set to "New window"
- [ ] The Link Target field is hidden and requires a fieldset to be opened in order to view the settings.

### Build/Deployment Steps
<!-- List any steps that need to be performed manually to complete the work for this ticket. -->
1. Step 1

### Testing Instructions
<!-- Add any specific instructions for testing the acceptance criteria. -->
1. Step 1

title: fix: widget language should follow Drupal page language
body:
## Widget language should follow Drupal page language


## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a page builder page with a Boilerplate widget in Portuguese.
1. Visit the page in using the `/en/` prefix.

The widget shows in Portuguese.

## Expected behavior
The language is not configured by the editor, but kept in sync by the Drupal language.

## Resolution
### Acceptance Criteria (required)
- [ ] The Boilerplate widget is configured without a language selector.
- [ ] The widget changes it language when the page builder page is changed.
